required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical and Urodynamic Effects of Minimally Laser (IncontiLaseTM) Procedure for Female Stress Urinary Incontinence
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Urodynamic Effects of Minimally Laser (IncontiLaseTM) Procedure for Female Stress Urinary Incontinence

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to get the effect of IncontiLaseTM procedure; and its impact on urinary symptoms and female sexual function.

detailed_description.textblock: To get the objective urodynamic and sonographic effects of IncontiLaseTM procedure on women with stress urinary incontinence; and its impact on urinary symptoms and female sexual function.

primary_outcome.measure: The change of pad weight from baseline
primary_outcome.description: The change of pad weight from baseline after IncontiLaseTM procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of maximum urethral closure procedure from baseline
secondary_outcome.description: The change of maximum urethral closure procedure from baseline after the IncontiLaseTM procedure by urodynamic studies

other_outcome.measure: The change of female sexual functional score from baseline after treatment
other_outcome.description: The change of female sexual functional score from baseline after treatment

other_outcome.measure: The change of periurethral blood flow from baseline

intervention.description: Utilizing laser (IncontiLaseTM) to treat the anterior vaginal wall area to intensify periurethral tissue and achieve urinary continence

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All consecutive sexually active and parous adult women with the complaint of stress urinary incontinence
Exclusion Criteria:
- < 20 years old female

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology, National Taiwan University Hospital
